docs.text: Cloudflare-Router A library for easily processing incoming requests to Cloudflare Workers. Created with TypeScript! This module is super-easy to use, and it's plug-and-play. Literally. All you have to do to start is to tell the module when you want to process a request, and it will handle everything for you. In order to tell the module when it should process a request (or more specifically ,telling the router ): const { Router } = require("cloudflare-router"); const router = new Router(); const apiRouter = new Router(); // Connecting routers router.use("/api", apiRouter); // Setting up paths router.get("/", (req, res) => res.text("Hello, world!")); apiRouter.get("/", (req, res) => res.text("Welcome to the API!")); apiRouter.get("/welcome/:name", (req, res) => res.text(`Welcome, ${req.params.name}`)); // Listening for requests addEventListener("fetch", event => { // Minimal boilerplate required event.respondWith( router.serve(event.request) .then(res => res.response) ); }); Installing Simply enter the following command into your terminal: npm install cloudflare-router
docs.title: Home

docs.text: A library for easily processing incoming requests to Cloudflare Workers. Created with TypeScript! This module is super-easy to use, and it's plug-and-play. Literally. All you have to do to start is to tell the module when you want to process a request, and it will handle everything for you. In order to tell the module when it should process a request (or more specifically ,telling the router ): const { Router } = require("cloudflare-router"); const router = new Router(); const apiRouter = new Router(); // Connecting routers router.use("/api", apiRouter); // Setting up paths router.get("/", (req, res) => res.text("Hello, world!")); apiRouter.get("/", (req, res) => res.text("Welcome to the API!")); apiRouter.get("/welcome/:name", (req, res) => res.text(`Welcome, ${req.params.name}`)); // Listening for requests addEventListener("fetch", event => { // Minimal boilerplate required event.respondWith( router.serve(event.request) .then(res => res.response) ); });
docs.title: Cloudflare-Router

docs.text: Simply enter the following command into your terminal: npm install cloudflare-router
docs.title: Installing
